newsitem.title: USA: Insteel plant start-up costs to affect Q3.
newsitem.headline: Insteel plant start-up costs to affect Q3.

text.p: Insteel Industries Inc said it expects start-up related costs at its Virginia plant to affect the company's third-quarter financial results.
The company did not say how much the results would be affected. Officials from the company were not immediately available to comment.
The company also said, however, that its PC strand and collated fasteners businesses' operating levels improved during the quarter.
The company said it expects its collated business to generate "significant earnings during the remainder of the year." The company did not give specific figures.
The company on Friday reported second-quarter operating income of $0.08 per share, compared with $0.10 per share in the year-earlier period.
